title: Wide Mouth Bottle PP
excerpt: Autoclavable wide mouth polypropylene bottles are rigid, translucent and have excellent contact clarity. Available in multiple sizes.
content:
INVIROGENS is pleased to introduce our new line of Wide Mouth Polypropylene Laboratory Bottles, designed to meet the demanding requirements of modern research and clinical laboratories.
Autoclavable wide mouth polypropylene bottles are rigid, translucent and have excellent contact clarity. Polypropylene caps include a built-in sealing ring for leak-proof performance.
The wide mouth design facilitates easy filling, pouring, and cleaning. All bottles are fully autoclavable at 121 degrees Celsius for 20 minutes.
Available in 125 mL, 250 mL, 500 mL, and 1000 mL sizes. Graduated markings provide convenient volume measurement during use.
Ideal for media preparation, chemical storage, buffer solutions, and general laboratory use.

title: 15 ml Centrifuge Tubes with Snap Cap
excerpt: The tubes handle small amounts of liquid and are designed for storage, spinning down, as reaction vessels, or for separating samples.
content:
INVIROGENS 15 ml Centrifuge Tubes with Snap Cap are designed for your laboratory needs.
The tubes handle small amounts of liquid and are designed for storage, spinning down, as reaction vessels, or for separating samples.
The innovative snap cap design allows secure one-handed closure and opening, reducing the risk of cross-contamination when processing multiple samples.
Manufactured from high-clarity polypropylene with excellent chemical resistance, withstanding centrifugation forces up to 6000 x g.
Clear graduation marks are printed with solvent-resistant ink. Certified DNase-free, RNase-free, and pyrogen-free for sensitive molecular biology applications.
Available in bulk packs of 500 units and individually wrapped sterile packs of 50 units.

title: INVIROGENS EtBr Destroyer - Degrades EtBr, SYBR Green, SYBR Gold, SYBR Orange
excerpt: INVIROGENS EtBr Destroyer is a laboratory reagent intended for the removal and destruction of Ethidium Bromide contamination. It can also degrade SYBR Green, SYBR Gold, and SYBR Orange.
content:
INVIROGENS EtBr Destroyer is a laboratory reagent intended for the removal and destruction of Ethidium Bromide contamination.
It can also effectively degrade SYBR Green I, SYBR Gold, and SYPRO Orange stains used in nucleic acid detection.
The EtBr Destroyer is available in two formats: the Destroyer Bag for liquid contaminant treatment, and the Destroyer Sprayer for solid waste and surface decontamination.
The effect can be monitored and confirmed by UV light exposure whereby once the EtBr has been destroyed the fluorescence will disappear.
Safe: Demonstrated by Ames test to safely and effectively destroy EtBr without any mutagenic effect. The AMES test result data supports that the genotoxicity was reduced significantly.
This product provides an effective, economical, and environmentally responsible solution for managing hazardous nucleic acid stain waste in the laboratory.

title: INVIROGENS EtBr Destroyer - You Can Even Re-Use Your Buffer After Treatment
excerpt: INVIROGENS EtBr Destroyer is a specifically designed reagent to effectively degrade and destroy Ethidium Bromide, resulting in non-mutagenic and non-hazardous byproducts.
content:
INVIROGENS EtBr Destroyer is a specifically designed reagent to effectively degrade and destroy Ethidium Bromide and result in both non-mutagenic and non-hazardous waste.
One of the big economical benefits of using this product is that after using the INVIROGENS EtBr Destroyer, the once-contaminated buffer can be filtrated and used again without worry.
Economical: INVIROGENS EtBr Destroyer Sprayer bottles can be refilled after use and the bags are available in both a 10 and 20 pack. In comparison to the costs associated with properly disposing of hazardous materials, the EtBr Destroyer products save your money in the long run.
Safe: INVIROGENS EtBr Destroyer has been demonstrated by Ames test to safely and effectively destroy EtBr without any mutagenic effect.
The AMES test result data supports that the genotoxicity of EtBr contaminated solution, treated by both the INVIROGENS EtBr Destroyer Bag and Sprayer was reduced significantly and a negative result was determined.
